title: IllegalStateException if cache hit using @CacheResult happens within HttpAuthenticationMechanism.authenticate()
body:
### Describe the bug

Consider the following (not relevant stuff removed for brevity)

```java
@ApplicationScoped
public class CachingService {
    @CacheResult(cacheName = "counterCache")
    public int get() {
        return -1;
    }
}
```
```java
@ApplicationScoped
public class SomethingHttpAuthenticationMechanism implements HttpAuthenticationMechanism {

    @Inject
    CachingService cachingService;

    @Override
    public Uni<SecurityIdentity> authenticate(RoutingContext context, IdentityProviderManager identityProviderManager) {

        // This is the offending line
        cachingService.get();

        // This is just here to avoid a NullPointer downstream
        return Uni.createFrom().item(QuarkusSecurityIdentity.builder()
                .setAnonymous(true)
                .build());
    }
   ...
```

The above works fine in Quarks up to including `2.5.4.Final`, but it throws an `IllegalStateException` if `cachingService.get()` is a cache hit in Quarkus `2.6.0.Final` and above (checked up to `2.6.2.Final`, which is current stable at the time of writing.

### Expected behavior

Functions decorated with `@CacheResult` can be used in `HttpAuthenticationMechanism.authenticate()`.

### Actual behavior

Using functions decorated with `@CacheResult` in `HttpAuthenticationMechanism.authenticate()` cause the following exception when there is a cache hit:

### How to Reproduce?

~I'll push a small reproducer project shortly and update this sections with a link to it when I did.~

A small reproducer project can be found at https://github.com/j-be/quarkus-22874.

The line triggering the bug is [here](https://github.com/j-be/quarkus-22874/blob/692370ca787da1c5c24455dc05f6b1da6700ac06/src/main/java/org/owly/duckdns/quarkus/test/cache/SomethingHttpAuthenticationMechanism.java#L27-L28), but the bug only manifests if there is a cache hit, hence the cache needs to be preloaded, like I did [here](https://github.com/j-be/quarkus-22874/blob/692370ca787da1c5c24455dc05f6b1da6700ac06/src/test/java/org/owly/duckdns/quarkus/test/cache/test/CachingServiceTest.java#L19-L20).
